thread.title: Bonds’ Terrible Twins: Low Yields and Illiquidity
thread.title_full: Bonds’ Terrible Twins: Low Yields and Illiquidity - WSJ

author: Richard Barley
title: Bonds’ Terrible Twins: Low Yields and Illiquidity
text:
Talk to a bond investor, and low yields and illiquidity will quickly crop up in conversation. The two issues may be more tightly entwined than many think.
Much of the debate about bond-market liquidity has been about banks that have been required by regulators to hold more capital against risky assets. That has made it less attractive for them to act as market-makers and hold bonds on their balance sheets. But Citigroup’s credit...
